result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin M Staver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 5/1/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant can ask for an extension if making payments.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school.  COURT is OPPOSED to ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin M Staver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to [pay as ordered.  10 days HOC, consecutive.  Due & owing
DENYING, request for release on electronic monitoring.  Order signed and filed.  Copy sent to parties.  Court indicated at sentencing, that it is opposed to electronic monitoring.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

SENTENCING HEARING CONTINUED.  

Court spoke with defendant's agent.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 11 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and school.  COURT is OPPOSED to ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 5/1/2016, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant can ask for an extension if making payments.

DEFENDANT IS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defense counsel was tied up in another court, and unable to have sentencing done.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/1/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point status report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Case adjourned for state to get more information for sentencing as to the statements made in court by defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on 4/27/2015 at 8:30 am, in Branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court scheduled for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 3.   Negotiations ongoing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel was in a court trial before Judge Witkowiak this morning.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 11-17-2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment in order to further discuss this matter with ADA Loebel. State does not object to adjournment. Court grants defense request for adjournment.   Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Case adjourned to Branch 3.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Louis Epps for attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Sargent has just done closing arguments in a trial before Judge Wagner, and requests a new date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/27/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 6/10/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests more time to talk with the state.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Step Nolten for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kevin M Staver in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Kevin M Staver in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
